conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the suitcase
Gravitational force (G) is calculated as 150 N
Normal force (N) is the supporting force exerted by the ground
Frictional force (f) is calculated as f = μN
Pulling force (F) is 90 N at an angle θ above the horizontal
Resolve the pulling force into components
Horizontal component of pulling force is F_x = F cos θ
Vertical component of pulling force is F_y = F sin θ
Write the conditions for uniform motion
Horizontal component F_x balances the frictional force f
Normal force N balances gravitational force G and vertical component F_y
Solve for N using the vertical direction equation
N is calculated as 150 - 90 sin θ
Substitute N into the horizontal direction equation
Equation for horizontal direction is 90 cos θ = μ (150 - 90 sin θ)
Solve for μ
μ is calculated as 90 cos θ / (150 - 90 sin θ)
Determine θ using the minimum pulling force condition
Test θ = 37° and calculate cos 37° as 0.8
Calculate μ using sin 37° = 0.6 and cos 37° = 0.8
μ is calculated as 0.75
Final answer: μ = 0.75 and θ = 37°
